results.title: Suicide box
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A documentary video tape about the ‘Suicide Box’ - a motion triggered camera developed by the Bureau of Inverse Technology (a private information agency) and installed in range of the Golden Gate Bridge, San Fransisco. This vertical-motion triggered device is designed to capture a video record of anything that falls from the bridge in order to provide an accurate measure of the suicide rate at the bridge. Accuracy of measurement is often compromised by the presence of seagulls and brought into question by ironic observations about the contradictory roles played by technology within contemporary culture.

results.title: Suho and the white horse
results.brief_description: Legend has it that love shared by a poor shepherd lad and the white foal he finds on the Mongolian steppes underlies the creation of the first horse-head fiddle. A deeply moving story based on the children’s picture book.

results.title: Sugar bowl island
results.brief_description: Few of the world’s basic foods have so romantic and beautiful a source as sugar cane from the island of Mauritius. This film gives an account of its famous sugar industry and a general impression of life among the island’s various racial communities.

results.title: Suez in perspective
results.brief_description: A statement of the events which led to the action by Britain and France to arrest hostilities in the Suez Canal/Port Said area in 1957. An account is given of the allied operation, why it was considered necessary and the care with which it was carried out.

results.title: Suez Canal
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Peter Hopkinson, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Louis De Rochemont
results.brief_description: A brief history of the Suez Canal, showing the way the Suez and Panama Canals shorten trade routes. Superb use of animation based on ancient Egyptian art, illustrates how the Pharaohs dug several canals in the area. Oil prints show work of De Lesseps in financing and building the present canal. Live photography briefly shows how the canal is operated and maintained.

results.title: Suddenly last summer (Eastbourne)
results.creator_credit: Clare Beavan, Shauna Brown and Channel Four
results.brief_description: Together with women from all over Britain and abroad, Tyneside comedienne “Hufty” travels to the Mecca of lesbian fandom, the Pilkington Glass Ladies of Tennis Championships in Eastbourne. For many of the women any sacrifice is worth the opportunity to see their idol, Martina Navratilova, in the flesh.

constellations_other.name: The Hatfield House rules
constellations_other.description: The shooting location of The Favourite, Hatfield House, has appeared in a number of other iconic works.

results.title: Successful study skills
results.brief_description: Produced specially for Australian students undergoing senior years of schooling. Topics covered include: the need to establish a good study environment, good planning and time management principles, whole year planning, weekly timetable, the use of a student diary, the value of library research, stress and how to cope, relaxation techniques. Study guide included.
